content: the ultimate crochet the ultimate crochet pumpkin pattern pumpkin pattern written by dawn from the woven almanac podcast equipment list yarn of your choice i recommend dk weight or thicker 2 to 3 colours for the pumpkin leaf and stem eg orange green brown this pattern is intended to use no more than a half ball from your stash for the main body and scraps for the leaf and stem if you want a really chunky one you will need more yarn for the main body crochet hook a hook size appropriate for your yarn e g 4 0 mm g-6 us or 5 0 mm h-8 us stuffing tools pattern terms stitch terms 2 x stitch markers chain chain us uk tapestry needle st s stitch es single_crochet double_crochet scissors slip_stitch slip_stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet blo back loop only treble_crochet dtr pumpkin body 1 foundation row chain 26 single_crochet double_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook place a stitch marker in this first stitch single_crochet double_crochet in each of the remaining 24 chain total 25 sts 2 ribbing row chain 1 and turn single_crochet double_crochet in the first st and place a marker single_crochet double_crochet in the blo of each stitch to the stitch marker total 25 sts 3 repeat the previous row until you have a long rectangle for a plump pumpkin aim for a length of approximately 25-30cm 9-12 inches depending on your gauge assembly 1 forming the tube with your yarn still attached fold the rectangle so the short ends meet use a tapestry needle to sew the ends together with a running stitch or slip_stitch them together to form a tube 2 cinch the bottom thread a long tail of yarn onto your tapestry needle weave the needle in and out of the stitches along one open end of the tube pull the yarn tail tightly to cinch the opening closed knot securely 3 stuffing turn the pumpkin right-side out and stuff it with fiberfill until it is firm and plump 4 cinch the top repeat the running stitch and cinching process on the remaining open end pull the yarn tight to close the opening and knot it the ultimate crochet the ultimate crochet pumpkin pattern pumpkin pattern written by dawn from the woven almanac podcast creating segments 1 thread your needle cut a long piece of yarn and thread it through your tapestry needle 2 define segments push the needle from the center of the bottom of the pumpkin up through the stuffing and out the center of the top pull the yarn gently to define the first segment 3 repeat bring the yarn around the outside of the pumpkin push the needle back through the top and out the bottom pull to define the next segment repeat this process 5-6 times evenly spacing the segments around the pumpkin 4 secure knot the yarn at the bottom of the pumpkin and weave in the end stem
